author: leadnurse
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2020
review_content: I am a nurse. Brooks shoes are all the rage at the hospital with the nurses and doctors. That should tell you something about the comfort level of Brooks right there. These are incredibly comfortable. They’re also gorgeous - I am not sure I want to wear them to work. Spendy- but worth every penny.
title: Obsessed

author: Cheri Murphy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2020
review_content: Did online research for a running shoe to address my issues—high arches, history of plantar fasciitis, lower back issues—and found the Ghost consistently recommended. So far so good! The sole is soft and forgiving, and I’ve felt good running in them.
title: Addresses my issues

author: a mom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2020
review_content: I am 70 yrs old and my foot type requires a neutral shoe for my daily +2 mile walks.  This Black/Hushed Violet Ghost 13 is the perfect color for me personally:  I have been waiting for a black Brooks Ghost WITHOUT being totally stark black or black with stark white soles.  The Hushed Violet is subtle, more like soft grey, true to the pictures posted.  The Ghost 13 continues to have a comfortable toe box for my bunions.  It will easily accommodate prescription orthodics.  My orthopedist highly recommended the Brooks Ghost 10 yrs ago and I have worn them since...even more so,  since I have had injuries wearing slip-on shoes when I should not have: have had a torn left anterior tibialis tendon and developed a torn meniscus in my right knee while recovering from that my foot injury!  I am thankful Brooks Ghost started coming in more neutral colors since Ghost 11, since I wear them for most all occasions every day, all day now.
title: Perfect fit AND color

author: EnjoyTheJourney
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2020
review_content: First time I ordered a shoe online. I had never heard of Brooks shoes.  My previous brand was Saucony but they wear out too fast. These fit PERFECTLY. I jogged around my house the day I received them trying to find something wrong with them but they're perfect! Everyone has their own brand and I'm now sold on Brooks. I run 55-60 miles a week and need a sturdy, durable, comfortable shoe - Brooks is it for me.
title: Brooks Ghost 13 size 8 women's

author: Shannon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2020
review_content: I love this shoe. I loved the Ghost 12 but this one went the extra mile. They extended the cushioning to the forefoot. I don't run so my priorities are a little different.. I do HIIT and other cardio workouts that involve jumping and plyometrics. Since I have a wide short feet with high arches I tend to land hard on the forefoot. This shoe is like jumping on a foam mattress..soft and springy.
title: Forefoot cushioning in a shoe. Finally.

author: R. Burns
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2020
review_content: While my husband loves his ghosts, I do not. The angle of the sole makes my feet feel like I am walking out of the shoe. They are very uncomfortable. I ordered these through Amazon fulfillment and there is absolutely NO WAY TO CONTACT THEM!!!So the seller gets back with me and says "I have never actually returned something to Amazon. I believe it is under Your Orders tab, and you should be able to reach them. They should extend the date for you and we will surely honor that. Thanks."  THIS IS NOT HELPFUL AT ALL BECAUSE A BUYER CANNOT REACH AMAZON FULFILLMENT!!!!  IT IS A NO MAN'S LAND!!!!!
title: Do NOT ORDER FROM THIS Company - you will not be able to return and amazon will NOT help

author: kasey troutman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2020
review_content: The ghost 12 are  amazing these 13’s are spectacular with a little extra cushion all the way through the shoe! These do not disappoint!!! Shoe LOVE!
title: Shoesational!

author: shakamar
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2020
review_content: Great shoes. I’ve had the Ghost 11 previously and these don’t disappoint. They are comfortable and cushiony. I’ve had a few different styles of Brooks shoes in the past and prefer the Ghosts for their comfort. I walk several miles a day and love these shoes. Highly recommend.  Also I might add the shipper was great. The shoes came earlier than expected.  I ordered my regular size and they fit perfect.
title: Comfortable and Cushiony

author: emilyac
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2020
review_content: 10/10 would recommend for veterinary professionals/ medical professionals! I am on my feet 12-16 hours a day, and these are by far the best shoes I have used in veterinary hospital.They did take a few days to “break in” but did not cause much discomfort to my feet while wearing them. I wore them a few times before I wore them for a full shift and i think it helped!They clean SO WELL! Baking soda and hydrogen peroxide paste, scrub with a toothbrush, and rise with cold water and Good a s new! I clean them about every 2 weeks. I love light grey shoes and these hold up to cleaning better than any brand I have had in the past. (Nike, adidas, crocs, sketchers, Dansko).I have now had them for 5 months. They have held up to a lot of things most shoes will never have to go through. Most of my shoes only last 2-3 months, and I’m betting these will last at least a year!Love love LOVE these shoes!!!
title: Perfect for Veterinary / medical professionals and long shifts!

author: REBECCA
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2021
review_content: The reviews for these are off the charts but I was still worried about ordering an expensive shoe online, especially as I have a hard time getting a good fit - but they're *wonderful* for me. I haven't had such a comfortable shoe since the good old Saucony's that I used to run in decades ago.. Actually, it's the most comfortable shoe I've  ever worn, ever.  I'm 70, with glitchy hips and knees and a bit of foot neuropathy - just old feet - pretty normal arches and very slight supination. I bought my regular size 8 and they're a perfect fit. I never feel like I get enough toe box and everything wants to chafe the back of my ankle, and various other styles of "supportive " shoes/inserts just make me feel unnaturally arranged. These just *cradle* my feet somehow, toe-wiggle room, no pressure on that back tendon, and the right amount of support (neither squishy nor too stiff). I generally go around the house in Snoozies but I just don't want to take these off.  Nothing works for everyone, but from the reviews these seem to have the odds on their side. (I usually stick to low impact these days but actually broke into a jog on my test-walk - really good cushioning!) Long, gushy review, sorry, but jeez, what a great surprise!
title: Terrific shoe

author: Going Like Elsie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2020
review_content: A former ballerina, I have crazy high arches, a finicky knee and, I've only recently learned, an inclination toward supination. I also work out A LOT, more than usual since the pandemic, and I was plagued by perpetual Achilles' tendonitis and my knee was very sore. I researched a bunch of shoes, and settled on these. Best footwear purchase I've ever made. I still use my orthotics, which I supplement with extra arch support  inserts (as mentioned  -- crazy high arches), but by Jove, these shoes work. Haven't had Achilles' tendonitis since I got them, and my knee is rarely sore. the cushioning and support is fabulous. It took a day or two to get accustomed to them, but now they feel light and the way shoes should be. My only complaint is they've ruined me for all other shoes. That said, I do wish this company would make a line of stylish pumps and boots, too.
title: Best. Trainers. Ever.

author: BA
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2020
review_content: My first time buying Brooks. Decided after developing plantar fasciitis that I should invest in better running shoes. I typically wear 7.5-8. Bought and exchanged the 7.5 pair as well as the size 8’s with the toe box being way to small - tips of my toes practically touching the tip of the shoe. The 8.5 is a winner - I’ve never had to buy 8.5’s!
title: Runs small

author: Dosmit Raeh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2020
review_content: I stand on a concrete floor every day for eight hours, and needless to say by the end of my shift I was sobbing in my car from the pain in my back and feet. I bought some Brooks last year for work and they did great, really made a difference, so I invested in a new pair when I started working again after the shutdown. They are as great as the previous pair—comfy and well-made. I do put orthopedic inserts in, because no shoe can singlehandedly solve the problems of my feet, and I know that also makes a difference, but it would not work with another pair of shoes I don't think. I've tried the same inserts in other, less expensive shoes, and I have always sent the shoes back. Brooks is the first shoe I have kept and used for work and has consistently good performance results.If you too work a brutal service industry job, if you also stand on concrete floors for hours at a time because 'if you can lean, you can clean', borrow some money or stop eating for a month and invest in these shoes. Request them for [insert holiday of choice]. Upend the couch cushions for change. Then pair these shoes with the Walk Hero Plantar Fasciitis Inserts and *chef's kiss* your feet will be grateful and you will be less likely to chuck your lanyard into the sewer and walk into a lake.**I mean, you will still want to, can't change that. Hang in there.
title: Great shoe for service workers!

author: Techie Working Mother
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2021
review_content: Read tons of articles and reviews before giving these a try.  I’ve had rheumatoid Arthritis since I was 19 (so I e had it 37 years —you do the math to figure out my age) and as a result have some polyneuropathy (tingling and loss of sensation in both feet and my right ankle has been bone on bone for years ans hurts like heck if I go over 12,500 steps a day, but I’m still very active so these shoes are a great find.  Not running in them but normal day is over 10,000 steps ans a lot of standing up.  Have used some lightweight Nike flex runs as my everyday shoes for years but decided maybe it is time to look for more support.  Wish I had done that 10 years ago.  These check all the boxes for comfort, support, large toebox and great support for my bad ankle —I think I might make 20,000 steps pain free and maybe it will even save me from the need for an imminent ankle replacement surgery.  Can’t say enough food.  Lone the light blue color.  May save up and buy them in Lavender when my budget allows.
title: Great for arthritic feet with polyneuropathy!

author: Serena
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2020
review_content: Edited to say these went back. I wore them for about an hour around the house and they made my toes go numb and my calf hurt. Deducted a couple of stars because they were just so uncomfortable.So in running shoes I always try to get at least a half size up but I kind of wish I had gone a full size up in these. I don’t know if I’m just not used to having a shoe hug my foot the way these do but they feel a little snug. Not enough for me to return them. As far as comfort goes, at this price point I was expecting to feel like I was walking on clouds. I expected them to be super cushiony, but they aren’t. They feel kind of hard inside, if you know what I mean. This is my first pair of Brooks, I usually run in adidas.  Probably my last pair, because even though they’re beautiful and look snazzy, the comfort just isn’t there for a  $130 shoe. I’ll have to see how they do on my run tomorrow.
title: Not really impressed

author: Ladybug
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2020
review_content: I was looking forward to receiving my Brooks Ghost 13 shoes which are repacking my old Ghost12.  The description said they had more cushion and they do yet without loosing the solid support of my Ghost12.  The toe has a comfortable width so my toes aren’t squished.  And the lovely neutral color (black, hushed violet.  I don’t like violet but these are a soft  almost rose color) makes them an attractive shoe.  I almost don’t want to get them dirty walking!  I injured my left ankle twice and I have fibromyalgia which also causes muscle tightness resulting in pain.  I need a supportive shoe with some cushion.  It’s also flexible enough and lightweight so that they don’t feel clumsy.My previous shoes were size 8.5 and I decided to go up to a 9 to give a little more space especially because I add inserts.  These are perfect.  Usually adding the 1/2 size made me trip but the 8.5 was not quite right.They are true to the medium fit along the arch but I think they might feel tight for someone with a slightly wider foot so may want to try wide or a bigger size.  The toe area, however, gives plenty of room.
title: Comfortable, solid support, attractive style

author: Unik
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2021
review_content: The price for these sneakers may be costly but these sneakers are worth it! I've tried many sneakers from Altra, Mizuno, Ryka to compare against this Brooks brand and they have won with flying colors!!!!There aren't any better sneakers with as much arch support as these Brooks Ghost 13 sneakers have! You literally feel like you are bouncing when you walk without feeling like you're seeping into your shoe with every step. When you put on these sneakers it makes you want to work out (which is a plus for someone who dislikes exercise). It provides so much support for your calves and knees, which is a MUST for me.The outsole is actually wide enough for my normal width feet. It is not too narrow or too wide, like how some Men sizes can be. It has a full rubber sole so you have the traction you need even for wet rainy days. This is an all-season sneaker with enough support for all seasons without being too hot or cold. The design is very sleek and would look nice even on casual days out.I would definitely size up (at least a half size, although I did a full size) in any sneakers from the Brooks brand. I've tried three different style sneakers (Transmit 2, the Launch 5, and the Ghost 13) and I had to size up for all of them. Since there is so much support and cushion, I would allow a little extra wiggle room for larger feet.These are literally my favorite sneakers now and I'm glad I took the plunge (I never pay this much for sneakers LOL). I would highly recommend these sneakers from Brooks in the Ghost 13. For these other sneaker styles, the Launch 5 would be 2nd but nothing beats these Ghost 13. I encourage you to try these if you've tried all the other brands that haven't worked out thus far. In the past, I've tried all the popular brands including Nike and nothing compares to these (No, I'm not getting paid to say this LOL). I hope this review helps :)
title: The BEST of the BEST.... PERIOD!!!!!! 🏆👏🏾

author: Jenn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2021
review_content: just when Brooks develops a great shoe (ghost 12...or even 10) they screw it up by coming out w/ a new model that sucks (ghost 13 sucks. Ghost 11 was not as good as 10 or 12, and really the 10 was the best one yet....).  Hoping Brooks will go back to the drawing board.  I run neutral and this shoe has a weird support in it that feels off...the special foam runs down to far and goofs up running mechanics (it's like running on lumpy marshmallows) and they changed the size of the toebox...so lumpy marshmallows in a clown shoe. They did not really change the heel...just the toebox width...like apparently Brooks decided that evolution went haywire and human feet changed morphology during the pandemic. I mean, maybe...but my N of 1 says not so much. Same 8W women's feet missing her even numbered Brooks Ghost edition shoes.  Also, as a minor (but valid in my fashion world) complaint...what up with having all the cool shoes in the normal widths, and leaving us fat-feet girls with options like gray and black.  I want some cool-colored shoes too...running around sporting my off ebay 8 wide solid black shoes...my shoes match my granddad's shoes...just need to get some white socks....
title: ghost 13 suck

author: baxter girl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2021
review_content: I’ve been searching for all-purpose comfortable sneakers for a long time. I’ve bought and returned more styles than I care to admit. As soon as I put these on, I knew I’d found the ones. They’re cushioned, lightweight, supportive, don’t rub anywhere, no seams to chafe, nice looking, just perfect. I’ve worn them to the gym and walking the dogs and have logged quite a few miles on them. I don’t have “problem” feet, but they are sensitive - they are easily rubbed raw and sometimes prone to blisters, but these Ghost 13s have given me happy feet. They are expensive, but the comfort is well worth it, and I will buy another pair when these need replacing. I usually wear a size 9 in street shoes, but the 9-1/2 in these is just right. They are wide enough in the toe box so that my toes aren’t cramped. I like these sneakers so much that I bought a pair for my sister, who texted me that they’re the most comfortable sneakers ever. Here are just some of the other sneakers I tried and returned: ON Cloud, Adidas Ultraboost, Saucony Endorphin Shift, Ryka Focus XT
title: The Goldilocks of sneakers - not just for runners

author: Alice's Friend
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2020
review_content: I have several pairs of Brook's shoes, Ghost 11 and 12, which I thought were excellent shoes. I run and appreciate the extra cushion, but the Ghost 13 are not cushioned especially in the ball of the foot plus an annoying lump in the toe area in both shoes. Not worth the money! And should not have been named Ghost 13.
title: Not a good running shoe

author: M.T.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2020
review_content: In the past I would have scored comfort above style in a running shoe, but these shoes are just way too ugly. Another reviewer described these shoes as looking like "dad shoes" and that's accurate. Brooks missing the mark completely for women right now. Fit has changed over the years (although I will say this pair was an improvement in that area) and now apparently we aren't allowed the option of a decent looking shoe in stylish wearable colors. These "dad shoes" are going back. No thanks. Time to revisit ASICS options.
title: So ugly

author: Melissa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2020
review_content: True to size. Size 7 (regular) FITS SO COMFORTABLEEEE, i’ve never owned a shoe that felt like this. So happy with my purchase. Does not look or feel bulky at all.
title: Love it

author: RainMaker
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2020
review_content: So much pain! I wore these for 7 mins, just standing and walking around my house, and my knees started hurting so badly! They have ZERO arch support! (My very flat-footed daughter could not even feel it!) It took me a few minutes to notice why they hurt, but they caused my ankles to turn inward and my inner knees to touch. Very painful for my knees.  I don’t understand the reviews for these shoes?! But obviously they just aren’t right for me/us. I will say, though, they seem very well made and have a good bounce in the sole. The liners come out, too, so you can try your own inserts if necessary. However, I tried mine, and they felt totally different in these shoes. I don’t think there’s an insert with enough support to keep from turning one’s feet/knees inward.
title: ZERO arch support! Turn ankles/knees inward a LOT!

author: AB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2020
review_content: Not as good as the 12!  I’ve have several pairs of the ghost now, and I love them. However, while I haven’t yet put my finger on what is different from my prior pairs, something is! My feet hurt a bit more wearing the 13’s than any other pair.
title: Not as great as the ghost 11 and 12.

author: ABS
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2020
review_content: The Brooks Ghost are a very good fit for my foot  The shoe is comfortable and the style fits my needs. I am not a runner. I have had numerous foot surgeries. This shoe is comfortable and maintains the comfort level for many months of daily wear  Because of my personal issues I wear through the top of every similar shoe because of toe alignment. I just wish I could find a shoe where the toe area is reinforced to prevent wear.  Even with toe wear, I purchase the Ghost for the comfort, stability, lasting qualities and overall appearance. Previously I have worn an 8 1/2 in another brand for years.  I was fit for a size 9 Ghost and I have been very pleased with the fit and find each pair true to the size I now wear
title: High Achiever

author: SugarPlumFairy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2021
review_content: I needed some good athletic shoes. Something comfortable, supportive & neutral enough to blend with a variety of outfits. I love that they are solid black over the entire shoe. They are springy inside but not overly squishy. They are lightweight but feel durable enough to last a reasonable amount of time. I've worm them for 4 full days & find I do not have foot fatigue as quickly as usual. That's important to me, as a plus sized woman my feet can tire quickly. I ordered the 9W and the fit is spot on. Couldn't be more perfect. The price is worth it & this is the most I've ever spent on shoes so that's saying a lot. My husband had to talk me in to it after a good bit of research of what shoes would work for my foot & frame.
title: Wide foot in love with shoe

author: Snekrqueen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2020
review_content: The fit, support, and cushioning of these shoes is excellent. However, the colors are very drab, unlike the descriptions which suggest contrasting colors. But if color is not an issue, then I highly recommend these shoes.
title: A great shoe for walking, but not at all colorful.

author: Tammi Hall
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2021
review_content: I’m a lazy shoe shopper. I don’t like buying them and with the pandemic going on, it just made it easier for me to avoid buying new shoes. But I only had one pair of shoes that I wore everyday for over a year. So I really, really needed new shoes. My moms’ podiatrist had suggested this brand to me years ago. So I finally decided to try them. Great decision. I’ve started walking for my health and with the other shoes, my feet hurt ALL day. Now with these, so much support and comfort. I’m happy I finally bought new shoes. My feet are too. I fell like they run true to fit. I have a wide foot so I typically buy a 9 when I really wear a 8.5. I was able to get the 8.5 wide with these. I recommend them.
title: I really needed these

author: Mara Lockwood
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2021
review_content: I gained some extra weight in my second pregnancy and developed plantar fasciitis pretty early on. I continued running on it, not knowing the damage I was doing, and it became severe enough to finally see a podiatrist. PF confirmed, and I was sent home with a list of approved shoes to try. I was comfortable in a worn pair of Brooks Levitate 2, but the reviews for the 3 concerned me. I tried the Ghost 13 after reading through reviews and I'm so glad I did. First, for me, there was NO BREAK IN period. This was crucial for me considering the pain I was already in. As long as I do the stretches, massages, and icing, and most of my movement in my Ghost 13s, I've seen so much improvement. I'm about 10 days away from giving birth, and even though I've inevitably gained more weight, I believe these shoes were a key ingredient to the healing of my PF. I bought 2 more pairs and feel the same about all 3, no break-in, extreme comfort, perfect support for my feet.
title: A Pregnancy Plantar Fasciitis Godsend!

author: Loves_2_read
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2021
review_content: As a nurse working 12+ hour shifts, good support is key.  I can’t tell you the number of sneakers I’ve purchased that ended up going back to the store.  I saw a review of these sneakers and decided to give them a try.  They’re a bit more money then I typically would pay but I figured that if they’re that good, it’ll be worth it.For the most part I’m very happy with these sneakers. The fit is good, if you’re someone that can be in between sizes, go with the one you buy the most.  I found that there’s room in the toe box to give you a little leeway. They’re very light weight and have good padding and support.  I like the style and have gotten compliments on the sneakers almost everyday I’ve worn them.The only issue for me is that I tend to pronate a bit on one foot as that arch is collapsing and these shoes can irritate that area a bit after a long day.  I took a look at Brooks website and it seems as though these shoes are best for neutral walkers or people that supinate (foot rolls outwards). They have another pair that’s better for people that pronate and I might give them a try for work and just keep these shoes as everyday shoes instead.
title: Best for neutral walkers or those with supination

author: Christopher C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2021
review_content: I’ve been buying the Ghost for years. I’m not sure what happened, but they aren’t the same anymore. The arch support and cushion is lacking, compared to the past models. My feet start hurting halfway through a workout. Too top it off, after one month of wear, the rubber on the sole is falling apart in chunks! It’s worse on one shoe then other.  Due to weather, I haven’t even got to take this outside yet. I was able to wear the past models, until the sole naturally wore down from mileage. I’m so disappointed and looking for recommendations.
title: Quality isn’t what it used to be. So disappointed.

author: Rachgrav
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2021
review_content: I purchased these on March 18 (received the 20th) and as of today (6/9/21), this is how they look. For $130, I am SO disappointed in the quality of these shoes. They are comfortable, but are already showing considerable wear after a few short months. I do not wear them daily. I do walk trails a few times a week  (anywhere from 7,500-14,000 steps, moderate incline) and had hoped this would be a more reliable and comfortable shoe. They were true to size for me. The comfort level is there, but these show more wear than other name brands that I have purchased that are significantly less in price. This was not the great investment that I had hoped for in a walking shoe.
title: Questionable Quality

author: Martha
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2021
review_content: I had high expectations for these shoes, after using them one month i can tell you that they are comfortable BUT they are pretty much falling apart. I dont even understand how this can happen in such a short period of time. I wear them with socks every time, how can they be breaking like this so fast? Love the shoes but i think i got sent a bad quality pair, at least that is my hope. I am attaching a picture so you can see for yourself what is happening.thanks!
title: disappointed

author: Wendancer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2021
review_content: After reading the reviews, I ordered a pair a pair of the Brooks Women's Ghost 13 Running Shoe.I work in the hospital and walking on my feet 12 hours.The first 3-4 hours were fine, but by the 12 hr, my feet were hurting.  They seemed to have pretty good arch support, but the padding is too thin at the front of the foot. Therefore the constant pounding on hard floors, proved too much for these shoes.The next day I had to slip in some inserts, which is the only reason I can wear them. (I cannot afford another pair, so I'm forced to continue to wear these)Unfortunately, for health and safety reasons (and in good conscious) , I cannot return shoes that have been worn on the COVID unit.I paid $120 for these shoes and now I'm STUCK with uncomfortable shoes, sore feet, and $120 less in my bank account.Times are so hard right now and it was a real gamble to spend this kind of money on just one pair of shoes, sad for me,  I lost  :'(
title: Brooks name disappoints!

author: Jennifer Barclay
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2020
review_content: I have ALWAYS worn Brooks for my running and walking...and I do A LOT, but what, in the name of all that is holey, is this? See pic. I've only had them for 1 month today and only been WALKING 130 miles. This should not be!  Very disappointed!
title: WHAT the HOLE???

author: Dylan T Cannon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2021
review_content: With each new version of this shoe the cushion decreases. These version has no heal cushion.  I wish I could return these...I've added cushion inserts just to use them as workout shoes.  I'm older and need the cushion...I pay extra to have cushion so that I can continue to work out.  The toe box is more narrow as well. I'll be trying another brand.
title: Not as much cushion as the 12

author: Ariel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2020
review_content: These are my 2nd pair of brooks running shoes! I have tried other brands saucony asics but nothing truly compares to the quality, comfort and durability of brooks. This shoe has a dynamic feel as if my foot is being held in a cradle. I love tread patter as well as the thick support that encases the back of your heal. I wear a size 9 I find that they fit true to size although my foot is “normal” as in I’m not wide footed or narrow. I can easily move my toes which is nice. I don’t like running shoes to feel sophisticating. Highly recommend giving these a try.
title: Comfy and snug

author: Stephanie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2021
review_content: This is not my first pair of Brooks, but this is my first Ghost 13. I have been walking in these over the past week trying to break them in and they are still very stiff. The toe area on my left shoe started to click after a few days with every step I take. I thought it would go away once it was broken in a bit more, but it just does it more now. If it continues after another week, these shoes will find their way to the trash. The clicking is very annoying to walk in so I am sure running in them would be even more annoying. I will buy from a local shop next time so I can return when they don't work properly.
title: Toe area clicks and pulls fabric down on top of my toe

author: Cathy N
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2021
review_content: Love these shoe! A PT professional recommended them from her own experience.  Purchased because of plantar fasciitis issues under foot. They are very comfy, supportive, flexible. Feels like I am walking on clouds the way they cup my feet just right.  The gray ones look great with soft blue blue jeans and gray workout clothes. I generally wear a 9.5 shoe and the 9.5 was perfect size. The shoes comfortably hug my heel so that they don't slide or irritate the heel area when walking. I Love the fit. I have ordered so many shoes from Amazon only to send them back because they were too big or non supportive until I ordered these. First time order fit perfectly. I am still in rehab phase of walking so I can't tell if they have enough traction for uneven gravel surfaces. They do grip/squeak when they get wet. But, I love that sound, reminds me of basketball days of my youth. I am extremely happy with my purchase.
title: Oh, Ah,...love, love these exercise shoes.

author: Shondra
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2021
review_content: I have owned many brands of running shoes in the past, but this is my first pair of Brooks for running.  I can't even describe how much better they have been than any previous shoes.  A couple of problems I have had with multiple brands have been that the balls of my feet would start to hurt after a certain number of miles, plantar fascitis, and toes going numb on one foot.  NONE of this with the Brooks.  The size is on target with other brands.  My size for regular shoes is 6.5-7, I always go up a 1/2 size in running and hiking shoes.  The 7.5 fits perfect.  I did not change out the insoles--the ones they come with are great.  These are the absolute best!!!
title: The absolute best!!!

author: yaya
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2021
review_content: i like everything about these shoes. i ordered primarily because i have planter fasciitis and they were recommended.  i  normally wear a 10 to 10.5, but based on some information i received,  i ordered a size 11. they fit perfect and feel great. plenty of room in the toe box and still secure around the ankle.  they are nice looking and comfortable. i still have pain in one heel ( i didnt expect the shoes to cure the PF). i was just looking for comfort and hopefully more comfort while walking.  these feel so much better than the NB i was wearing and they just make my feet feel better over all. i love the black on black color.
title: comfy and attractive

author: Stephanie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2021
review_content: Fast delivery. True Brooks comfort. I have high arches and was ready to try the Ghost 13. I'm sadly disappointed in the arch support in this shoe. Yes, I realize that this is a "neutral" shoe, however; from all of the online research it states that this is a great shoe for comfort AND high arch support. Comfort gets an A+ FOR SURE!! Support, meh. Since I'm in love with the comfort I will most likely purchase a slip in arch support.My daughter has high arches as well so I purchased her the Adrenaline GTS 21... waiting her review.ADVISE:  After reading a lot of the reviews on sizing I went ahead and ordered a half size up. I normally wear a 9. I'm still deciding if I'm going to return and get a size 10. It's a little snug. I really don't want the hassle of having to return but being that they are expensive, I need a shoe that fits 100%.
title: Ghost 13 Womens

author: jennifer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2021
review_content: Defect in the left shoe. Pulls and material gets distorted with each step. Feels like a structural defect when I walk.
title: Defect in left shoe

author: CLL
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2021
review_content: I am a diehard Brooks fan and have been a diehard Brooks Ghost model fan, but... it may be time to rethink this stance....I purchased my first pair of Brooks Ghost in early 2016 when I was told by a fellow runner that they were excellent for wide feet and very "cushiony".  I purchased Ghost 8's and fell in love with the comfort.  The day they arrived I was pressed for time and needed to get in a workout before dark so I didn't even stretch before my run and managed to run 3 miles without any discomfort what so ever!  I was so amazed I sat down and wrote a glowing review the same day.I managed to wear out 2 pair of Ghost 8's before I had to move to the next version, Ghost 9.  These were not as comfortable but were bearable. Since them I have had Ghost 11's (even less comfortable than the Ghost 9's) and now the Ghost 13's. The Ghost 13's are still good for wide feet but feel even less cushiony on the ball of my foot than the Ghost 11's.  The Ghost 11's felt like I was running on a hard surface so imagine even less cushion than that...[shutter]... :(Why oh why brooks do you keep removing cushion from the ball of the foot area while beefing up cushion in the heal.  HEY BROOKS!!!  JUST ADD MORE CUSHION TO THE BALL OF THE FOOT to balance out the cushion level in the heel!!!I am still trying to decide if I want to return them or spend even more money to by a high-end orthotic to add a more comfortable level of cushion to the ball of the foot.  Either way I think it is time to rethink my loyalty to the Ghost line.... :(
title: Ghost 13's - just ok but not enough cushion in the ball of the foot area

author: Janet Mordeci
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2021
review_content: This product is clearly used and not new as expected. There is a hair stuck in the shoe and pitting on the back of the shoe. Some of the shoe is even missing on the bottom of the sole. For the price you would expect a clean shoe that isn’t used, I would not suggest/recommend this product. For the same price you can go to other places.
title: Clearly Used, not recommended

author: Laura
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2021
review_content: This shoe would be purrrrrfect of only there was the same softness under the balls o the feet as there is under the heals. Also, there are no cute colors selections for those of us who wear wide sizes: only black/black or black/white. I wonder why? Just because we have duck feet doesn't mean that we don't want them to look cute!
title: Just one thing is missing: "cloud" under the balls of feet

author: ohsoblessed
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2020
review_content: My Brooks Ghost 10 finally wore out. I loved them so much, I knew I wanted to go back to Brooks even though the price is higher than I normally spend on shoes. I went to a local sports store to try the different styles and still came back to the Ghost. It offers the support and cushion my feet need. I have recently been experiencing major lower back pain. Swapped out my work shoes for the Ghost 13 and started to feel some relief quickly. Highly recommend.
title: Like walking on clouds

author: Linda797
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2020
review_content: I bought these shoes because I had read many reviews that said that the toe box was very roomy.  Actually, I have a fairly narrow foot, but I have hallux rigidus and need a wider toe box to not put pressure on the big toe joint.  In no way would I consider this a wide toe box even with buying the wide width.  Will a shoe company finally make a true wide!!  If you don't have hallux rigidus or arthritis, I'm sure they would be fine.  They felt good on my left foot, but the right foot with the problem was a no go!  I returned the shoes.
title: The wide is not a true wide!

author: Shaquita Bonita
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2020
review_content: I only own one other pair of Brooks and its the Glycerin 17. For me that was the best pair I've ever owned and I needed a replacement. I would have went with the Glycerin 18 but the reviews were mixed and a lot of folks said how they changed the shoe and how it wasn't as good as a previous model. Why companies are always changing perfect products, I'll never understand. So, based on all the outstanding reviews for the Ghost model, I thought to give it a try.First of all, nice color choices Brooks offers in their shoes. I like them more neutral but it's nice they offer such variety. I loved the color I ordered. Also, I feel like there was good support and cushion. I walk around on concrete floors all day so I really need it.It seemed to be borderline running small compared to the Glycerin,  which when I say borderline I  mean I was able to wear them all day not really thinking they were hurting or too small. I just thought they weren't *quite* as comfy as my Glycerin 17... Until I took them off and oh man!! My feet hurt so bad! I'm telling you. I even soaked them for awhile and it didn't help. So I deduced that they had to have been just a tad small since my big toe on the one foot was especially in pain. You know how they say one foot is slightly larger than the other.I considered exchanging for a half size larger, but after that kind of pain I decided I didn't want to take any chances. I may try the Glycerin 18 (once I've recovered from the foot pain). In the meantime I found my beloved Glycerin 17 on ebay for $40. Yes I know it's gross to buy used shoes but if you have a hard time finding shoes like me you want to stick with what you know and love. I see that I can still find the Glycerin 17 online but I guess the price goes up?? On "retired " models and I can't afford $250+!  for tennis shoes....
title: Not as good as Glycerin 17

author: april harlow
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2021
review_content: I have had these shoes for 8 months now and they're still just as comfortable now as when I first started wearing them. Yes they're a little expensive but I can honestly say it was well worth the money.  Before buying these shoes my feet and legs would hurt so badly after an 8 hours shift in my factory job that it hurt to walk even the next morning. I can now work the same hours and do more walking than before buying these and my feet and legs feel great. I'm not up all hours of the night rubbing my legs down with muscle rub or crying because they're hurting so bad, and I can get up and walk without any pain. I would and have absolutely recommend these shoes to anyone who stand or walk for their living. I even recommended them to a co-worker who was having horrible foot pain after standing only a couple of hours with great relief for her. I have high arches and these support them without feeling like I have a rock or something trying to support my natural arch and walk. But go to their website first to go through their self examination and explanation of your own walk and stance to get the perfect shoe for you. You WILL NOT regret it.
title: Great Shoe for anyone on their feet all day

author: JDunc
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2021
review_content: Brooks are the best shoes for running, if you can find the right pair. I find that they are inconsistent. My Ghost 12’s were great! I had about 300 miles on them so I bought the new model 14, and the support is not the same. My foot is falling asleep during runs and I feel like my foot is hitting the ground at an angle in these shoes. They just are not like the previous pair I owned. I’m extremely disappointed.
title: Not consistent with Brooks normal quality.

author: seasara
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2021
review_content: Where have these been all my life?! Shopping for workout shoes is the bane of my existence. Ya girl’s got EE width feet and the world pretends they don’t exist. These are *perfect* width. I couldn’t believe it. I literally yelled in triumph when I put them on. My cat was understandably startled.And, they are cushioned and comfortable AF, with good support. I immediately went on a road trip where I did a lot of walking and light hiking. The soles are surprisingly grippy on paved and rough surfaces, even on snowy patches.Most good running shoes I’ve had in the past tend to be bulky and heavy. Not these. When I picked up the box, I honestly thought Amazon had sent me like a t-shirt by mistake. But I realized that’s just how light these are. It’s incredible.As with other athletic shoes, go half size up from your normal size.
title: The Trifecta: Comfort, Support, Width

author: Jennifer Miles
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2021
review_content: I ordered a half-size up to keep my toes from rubbing against the inside. Unfortunately the increased length seemed to be in the heel - my toes still banged against the shoe with every step, but my heel slipped in the back. So instead of solving one problem, I ended up with two. I don’t usually have fit issues with athletic shoes, so this really surprised me.These shoes were recommended for high arches. Maybe my arches are extra high - they don’t even make contact against the insole.I’m hoping that with some inserts and creative lacing, I can still salvage them. If not, these were an expensive mistake.
title: Disappointed

author: Kathy M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2021
review_content: Brooks have been the best running shoe for years, until the Ghost 13.  These are the most uncomfortable shoes I have ever worn, they cushioning feels hard, it doesn't give when you are stepping on it.  I thought maybe I had to break them in (which I've never had to do before) so I've only worn them in the house and on the treadmill, but I was wrong.  As a nurse who is on her feet for 12 hour shifts and then some, I can't afford to have sore feet.  Now I missed the window to return these.  What a shame, why mess with a design that was so good.
title: Changed the cushioning

author: Amy P.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2021
review_content: I run on a treadmill on a daily basis and participate in 5k's and 4-milers. I have never truly paid attention to my shoes, as long as they were athletic shoes. Now that I'm getting older, I have noticed the importance of proper running shoes. After a lot of research, these are it! I truly feel I made the perfect choice. Light and fit, along with the support, are just right. My times have become better and my evenings are pain free. My back, hips and knees are thanking me. I also love the colors and look of the shoe. I haven't had them long enough to comment on how they will hold up but I believe in Brooks as a brand so I'm not too worried. If anything changes, I will update.
title: LOVE these shoes!

author: Thankful Mom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2021
review_content: I have not liked tennis shoes for years. They always end up hurting the back of my heal or making my toes feel too stiff.  I’d been having a lot of heal pain, ankle pain, and I have very high arches.  These are wonderful. I LOVE wearing them, have walked for miles and never felt pain. Expensive, but so worth it to not have foot pain or leg pain. They are also a nice subtle color, they look mostly gray with a soft pinkish purplish accent that I was worried would be too flashy, but it’s perfect. My teen daughter tried to steal them. I figured I’d be more active, more willing to go for long walks if I had good shoes, and I find that is true. I really debated bc of the cost, but I am worth good shoes : )
title: So comfortable

author: Mgmt Ninja
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2021
review_content: I cannot tell you how much I love these shoes.  I previously purchased (and still have) a pair of Ghost 10s and needed a new pair - as all sneakers compress over time.  The 10s are still in great condition and I will continue to use them for yard work, etc.I read enough reviews to note that they changed the fit on the Ghost 14s to a more narrow toe box.  Since my foot resembles Fred Flintstone's (all toes around the same length...like a block :) ), I knew it was going to have to be the 13s.  I order the "wide" fit, even though I think all of their shoes have a wider toe box, and they fit great right out of the box.  I do use custom insoles, so it takes a few wears to get the lacing tightness comfortable, but after that these are absolutely the best fit/feel for wide feet.  The standard insoles are meh, so I'd suggest replacing with Superfeet if you don't have custom insoles.
title: If you have wide feet, look no further

author: A. Cal
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2021
review_content: Feeling a little shocked at all the amazing reviews. I have planter fasciitis and some heel issues so I had high hopes for the shoes. These shoes are supposed to be so comfortable, have fabulous cushion and support. There is absolutely no arch support and the foot bed is super hard. I do not find them remotely comfortable. They literally say cushion on the foot bed but yet it’s like walking on concrete. Spent over $100 for the shoes and I will either have to trade out the insole or buy inserts to provide a little bit of cushion. So incredibly disappointed.
title: These shoes are not comfortable

author: Frederick S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2020
review_content: I do not usually spend $129 on a pare of sneakers just to walk in the mornings but I needed to change the way I felt after walking and after checking around I wanted to try a great pair of shoes to support my body and take away the bad aches after, like sore heals ,shins and legs.  I checked the reviews on this shoe and found that the medical personnel who responded and support this as their go to shoe was convincing.  I have been using the shoe for a week (5 days) and already see a difference in my heals not hurting, shins feel great and the legs are not sore.  I believe the support in the shoe is what has alleviated this issue.  I am very happy with this purchase.  I did follow the other recommendations and bought a half size bigger which was smart.  I would have given this a higher rating but I have only had them for a week.
title: Very comfortable.  Worth the money

author: Jenna May
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2020
review_content: These are well made and really cute but I have high arches and these came so highly reviewed. I’ve worn brooks in the past with good luck and was hoping these would be the best off all. They are super cushioned but in all the wrong places. Hardly any support in the arch but a ton of soft support around the ankle. They are really really  cute but I have to return them cuz they won’t work for me and also they run smaller than other brooks I’ve worn. My big toe was hitting the top painfully. Bummer.
title: Surprisingly not that great...

author: Kara
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2021
review_content: I have narrow feet. My feet do, however, have a full complement of toes, something the people over at Asics seem to have forgotten over the last several models of the Gel-Nimbus, so I had to start hunting a new shoe. Finally I found these, and noticed that a lot of nurses seemed to like them, which seemed like a good sign. Crossing my fingers, I ordered a pair in my usual 7 1/2, hoping to find something wearable.Mission accomplished, the shoes have room for all my toes in the toebox, but hold my heels down, and they're lightweight materials, with enough cushion I don't miss it...admittedly not as cushy as the Nimbus of three models ago, but it actually felt better than recent models of that shoe, so still winning.The color I got was a soft black with a super dusty (read grey) purple trim color, and they're subtle/pretty. I bought a backup pair after wearing these for a week, and hope that gets me through the year, and next year's model is also comfortable and let my toes breathe!
title: Comfy from a Nimbus Refugee

author: Jillian
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2020
review_content: Fits perfect and you can really feel the cushion on the forefoot. This shoes feels better than the Ghost 12, and lighter to me. I use this on the treadmill, like every shoes it needs to be broken in. So today was the second time I wore it and feels good on my feet. I have high arches and plantar fasciitis, and this shoes helps me. I will definitely buy another one!
title: Forefoot Cushion!

author: pmilli
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2021
review_content: These are my favorite road running shoes for my narrow feet. That being said, there isn't a huge selection of running shoes that actually come in narrow widths, rather than shoes that I'm told "run narrow" which are never narrow enough for my actually narrow feet. I like the comfort and support. I took 1 star away because the soles wear out pretty quickly. I wear a 9-9 1/2 narrow in regular shoes. I always go back and forth between a 10 and 10 1/2 in ghosts, seems to depend on which ghost. 10 1/2 was a little sloppy so I have 10s in these.
title: my favorite road running shoe for my narrow feet

author: Tiffany M. Alexander
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2021
review_content: I ended up buying a pair of Brooks Ghost 13 after trying some on at an Academy just after the holidays and finding how they perfectly they fit me feet!  I even went down a size from an avg of 8 to a women's 7.5 after trying their wide version.  It dawned on me after several trips back to the chiro that my hip pain started after buying a new pair of Sketchers... Tried the Ghost 13's and to my astonishment, my hip pain went away!  They are not shoes you have to break in either, they just fit and were comfortable from day 1.  I tried a different Brooks shoe (Adrenaline GTS 21) and they hit my foot in a weird place on the outside and so returned those and ordered a solid black pair of the Ghosts and a black pair with a touch of violet so not bright white but you can barely tell they're not white unless you hold them next to something truly white.  Once you find the right shoe in this brand for your feet, they are awesome!  I never thought I'd spend this much on tennis shoes but I now have a fleet of them :).
title: Helped with hip pain!!!

author: charlotte
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2021
review_content: I'm diabetic, rt. Foot a bit messed up so it's difficult to find comfy. Non-dorked out, special needs looking, clunky sneakers.  I also have a wide foot, thick foot.  Don't be jealous.Anyway, I'm more comfortable on flat sneakers & shoes because I can't fully feel the ground if there's a thick platform under a sneaker....like this one.  So Why buy it?  Because of the reviews I took a chance.  I took out the thick insole & put in a more thin one.  It's just a better option for me.  Because my feet are thick, Shallow shoes are a problem.  Taking out the thick insole gave me more depth.  They fit great!  Nice toe room,  which is always a concern.  It takes some getting used to walking in them.  I keep thinking I'll fall or my foot will roll left, due to them not being flat.  Always a concern.  So far, feet steady. I think I'll keep them.
title: This Diabetic Finds Them Comfy

author: Loni R. Renick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2021
review_content: I first bought the ghost 11’s about 3 1/2 years ago and I still have and love them. I purchased these 13’s just about a year ago and they have not held up. The outer sole design is a downgrade from the 11’s resulting in less support. I love the ghosts for their look and high arch support. I am disappointed in these as they began hurting my feet after about 3 months, whereas I still wear my 11’s with no pain. I hope the 14’s have been improved beyond the state of the 11’s since that is what I had expected out of the 13’s. Paying these prices for tennis shoes is worth it so long as they do what is claimed and improve with each new model. Brooks needs to get it together. I hope they have. I’ll know soon as I have ordered the 14’s. (P.S. even the mesh has fallen apart on my 13’s after only a year meanwhile my 11’s still good as new and have been worn more than twice as much).
title: Not as good as the ghost 11’s

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2021
review_content: I love the Ghost version of Brooks! I ordered these for a new job I'm getting ready to start. I'll be on my feet alot, so I know these will support that. The only disappointment I have with this pair is that the pink that's on the shoe is so faint, it almost looks white. The pictures on the site show a brighter pink. You can't even hardly see it. My favorite color is pink. That's why I ordered this pair. But, I'll just keep them because they'll serve their intended purpose.
title: Brooks Ghost running sho

author: rachel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2021

author: Michelle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2020
review_content: I walk 25-30 miles a week and I have a very hard time finding shoes that are comfortable to fit my super slim feet. I wear a 9.5 SS. I usually wear New Balance because they come in widths so when I heard Brooks Ghost 13 came in narrow widths and read all the positive reviews about it I thought I would give them a try. I am so glad I did. They fit like a glove. . I walked 5 miles in them the first time I wore them and they were so comfortable. If you have hard to fit feet like mine I highly recommend you give these a try
title: Comfort for my narrow feet

author: Faolain Gomez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2021
review_content: I absolutely love these shoes. I have planters fasciitis in my left foot. It is so painful after I've been on my feet all day, when I sit down or sleep then get back up it hurts so much. I’ve been wearing these everyday and my pain is almost completely gone. It will take awhile to go away (I've had it in my right foot before too) but these shoes have been helping with the healing process immensely. I can take them off and feel no pain when I walk and when I wake up in the morning? NO PAIN!!! I brought myself another pair of brooks for running as well (the glycerine model) and just over all highly recommend the Brooks brand. The cushion is soft but offers a ton of support. If you want a snug fit order your size but if you like a little space for your toes I’d recommend a half size up. I’m an 8.5 but I purchased a size 9. I don’t regret my purchase at all and will be getting another pair at the end of the month for myself. If you have foot pain no matter what your amount of time being on your feet is these shoes are for you. I recommend also going on the brooks website and taking their test to see which shoe style would be best for your foot. You won’t regret it! What you will regret is waiting until they no longer have the style/color you like. No one wants an ugly shoe and with these you don’t need an ugly looking shoe to be comfortable.
title: Foot pain? BUY IT

author: L
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2021
review_content: I originally ordered an 8.5. Sometimes I'm a 9, so it can be a gamble trying to decide what to order with an unfamiliar brand. These run just a tad small, so order up if you're between sizes. Awesome shoes! Super comfortable and very nice looking. I walk 3-4 miles ~5 days a week and have yet to get a single blister.
title: If you're sometimes between sizes, go up.

author: Kimmie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2021
review_content: I work out daily and I am coming from a pair of Hoka shoes. Those were very supportive and extremely cushioned but they make your feet look massive. As a short girl with big feet already, that is not attractive! This is my first pair of Brooks and I would say it is what I expected based on the reviews I read. As a side note I am very flat footed so I need arch support.  I think I will likely have to get some sort of gel inserts to make them a little more supportive and cushioned for hard landings. They are perfectly fine for weight training but not anything with hard  cardio. For the price, they are worth it so far after 3 days of working out in them. Sneakers are so expensive now I feel it is almost impossible to find a good fitting pair under $120.
title: Very comfortable but not supportive for flat feet

author: Priceisright
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2020
review_content: No longer a mizuno girl!  I have been loyal to Mizuno because they were one of the only running shoes I could find in a women’s 12 and in a narrow width. Well, they stopped making narrow shoes and I am so happy I found these!  They fit like a glove with no break in period. I was a little worried because the toe box seemed roomy, but they are great!!  Absolutely thrilled with them. They run true to size, so order what you’d normally wear.
title: No longer a Mizuno girl!

author: G. Misa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2020
review_content: Love, love these shoes!  Was looking for an all black shoe....Lots of times i have to break my shoes in but these were comfortable  from the start...went for a 3 mile walk and no soreness, no blisters from shoe rubbing.  I do have wide feet...and grew up wearing size 6.5, 7s...for the first 50 yrs of my life....but since going to get sized at the Roadrunner Sports store...was advised I wear size 8 wide..heehee said most women are wearing the wrong sized shoes.....we need to account for normal swelling thru the day.  Anyhow these were 8Ms and fit perfectly for me.
title: My first all black sports shoe....sooo comfy!

author: emirree
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2021
review_content: These shoes fit like an absolute DREAM. The second I put them on and went outside, they felt SO light, like I was walking on a comfortable cloud. I often have foot pain when walking because I have some clogged sweat glands on my feet that hurt really badly, but these made them seem like they disappeared completely. That evening I went for a run to test them out, and it was like heaven. They felt like an extension of my own leg, and I highly recommend them. If you’re thinking about it, just do it! Just take into account that they need to be broken in, and if you’re like me where one foot is slightly bigger, it may rub on the back of your ankle because the ankles are pretty stiff starting out. If I could get one 7 and one 7.5 that would be perfect! LmaoOther than that, they’re just what I wanted in a road-running shoe, highly recommend!
title: Fits like an extension of my own leg, so so happy!!

author: Alex
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2020
review_content: I have plantar fasciitis and it’s hard to find good shoes but these do the job! I have a neutral gait so this is the shoe that was recommended for me. They are very comfortable and have good support. I ordered a whole size up to give my feet more room and I’m glad I did. I’m usually a 10 and ordered an 11 which fit great!!
title: Comfy and supportive!

author: Brian
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2021
review_content: A couple of things to be mindful of when purchasing... 1. The material is very unforgiving. The lighter colors are pretty but they stain easily.  I've only had mine for 4 months and have stains that seem to be impossible to get out. It's really disappointing.2. I did have an issue where the heel kept moving against my heel and creating blisters. This may have been my own fault because maybe my size choice was off-- but even after re-lacing them to fit better and not rub.. there is now a hole in the inside wall where my heel sits.I wore these shoes religiously for four months. I work in healthcare and am frequently outdoors in my free time and travel. The comfort and sturdiness of the shoes are unmatched. Love how comfy they are once they are broken in. Just wish... With that price.. they would be a bit sturdier. After 4 months I'm already looking for a different pair due to dirt stains that refuse to come out of the fabric and the clear wear already on the outside and inside of the shoe itself.
title: Great shoe-- but could've been better. Especially with the price

author: Amanda S Black

review_content: These are NOT the usual quality BROOKS.That’s either because these are NOT BROOKS or this model has been downgraded substantially from the Ghost 12.Either way I had to return them the toes felt like cardboard and “popped” as I took a stepOnly order these from the real website.
title: NOT BROOKS!!!!

author: Brooke Marie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2021

author: Petunia P.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2021

author: Lauren

author: Elizabeth

author: carol b
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2021
review_content: Bought for 12 hour on my feet shifts. I ordered usual size but in wide width to account for any foot swelling. First shift, right out of the box, of wear, LOVE them. The shoes are a bit bulkier than what I’m used to but very lightweight.
title: Yes

author: Pepperpot
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2021
review_content: When I first tried these shoes they felt great. author: Amanda
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2021

I'm a big girl and these saved me. They're with the price tag. Just make sure you get the right ones for your feet.

author: Lindsey Layton

author: Cavalier

author: StacyT

author: RT
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2021
review_content: The shoes are great. Comfortable, supportive, no break-in time for me. I took away a star because the shoes I received had clearly been worn before. My guess is someone gave them a shot, didn’t love them, and I was the lucky winner to purchase their return. Doesn’t feel super cool to pay $130 for previously worn shoes but they didn’t smell or have obvious wear on the tread so I kept them. $130 is a splurge for me so it was disappointing to not get brand new shoes but like I said, they’re comfortable and fit great. I’ve gone through 3 pair of Saucony Omni and I like these better than any of those.
title: Love the shoe but......

author: Shoptoomuch
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2021
review_content: I bought these 3 months before my scheduled half marathon. I trained in them, broken em in, then the days leading up to the Savanah Rock N Roll 2021 marathon, rain was reported. I'd trained for so long and so hard that there was zero chance I wasn't running. The morning began with standing in an inch of rain for an hour with more rain falling. Water pooled in my shoes. When I began to run I felt the water leave my shoes. The rain was so heavy the air was so cold and the streets were littered with puddles. Never once did my sole slide inside my shoe. Not a single blister. When the race done and my shoes had been water logged for 4+hours with travel to and from the race, I removed the soles and placed the shoes upside down and at a 45 degree angle to dry. 2 days later they were fully dry. I took em for a 5k upon drying and they feel as good as before the marathon.
title: Survived a Nor'Easter

I ordered a 9 in these and they’re perfect.

review_content: I’ve had these 2 months and walk about 30 miles a week. I usually love Brooks as my feet are very temperamental. author: DogBitez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2021

author: Cocoa

author: LilyL

author: HF

author: cc

author: Carolina Girl

author: A. Bumpers

Highly recommend these shoes!

author: Mary

author: Clairemont
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2021

I doubt I will ever buy anything other than Brooks again & wish I had discovered the brand much sooner in life.

author: Amazon Customer

author: NJCarp

author: LionDogLady

author: serendipity

author: Mary Ellen

author: Rachael-K

author: Kristin Curry
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2021

author: Miranda Skenes

author: Jessica

author: Mykayla
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2021
review_content: While these do have extra thickness in the heal compared to the glycerin, they feel a littlecheap in the insole and aren’t very cushion-y or soft. Overall, satisfied with my purchase but may stick with the Brooks Glycerin.
